get.summary: Returns Bible Filesets which have Audio timestamps
get.description: This call returns a list of fileset that have timestamp metadata associated with them. This data could be used to search audio bibles for a specific term, make karaoke verse & audio readings, or to jump to a specific location in an audio file.

204.description: No timestamps are available at this time

get.summary: Returns Audio timestamps for a specific reference
get.description: This route will return timestamps restricted to specific book and chapter combination for a fileset. Note that the fileset id must be available via the path `/timestamps`. At first, only a few filesets may have timestamps metadata applied.

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The specific fileset to return references for

parameters.name: book
parameters.description: The Book ID for which to return timestamps. For a complete list see the `book_id` field in the `/bibles/books` route.

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter for which to return timestamps

get.summary: Returns audio timestamps for a specific word
get.description: This route will search the text for a specific word or phrase and return a collection of timestamps associated with the verse references connected to the term

parameters.name: audio_fileset_id
parameters.description: The specific audio fileset to return references for

parameters.name: audio_asset_id
parameters.description: The specific audio asset id to return references for

parameters.name: text_fileset_id
parameters.description: The specific text fileset to return references for

parameters.name: text_asset_id
parameters.description: The specific text asset id to return references for

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The specific book id to return references for.  For a complete list see the `book_id` field in the `/bibles/books` route.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The tag for which to return timestamps

get.summary: Get a list of bible equivalents
get.description: Fetch a list of bible equivalents filtered by Type, Organization or Bible. This route will allow your apps to connect to other Bible APIs and services without introducing duplicate Bible content into your apps and ease migration between APIs.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The organization id to filter equivalents by

parameters.name: bible_id
parameters.description: The Bible id to return equivalents for

get.description: Returns a an entire fileset or a selected portion of a fileset for download

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The fileset ID

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id

parameters.name: fileset_type
parameters.description: The type of fileset being queried

parameters.name: book_ids
parameters.description: The list of book ids to download content for, separated by commas. For a complete list see the `book_id` field in the `/bibles/books` route.

200.description: The requested fileset as a zipped download

get.description: A fileset's copyright information and organizational connections

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The fileset ID to retrieve the copyright information for

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id which contains the Fileset

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The set type code for the fileset

parameters.name: iso
parameters.description: The iso code to filter organization translations by. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route.

get.description: A list of all the file types that exist within the filesets
The base bible route returning by default bibles and filesets that your key has access to

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The iso code to filter results by. This will return results only in the language specified. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description:
The owning organization to return bibles for. For a complete list of ids see the route
     *              `/organizations`.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset_id to filter results by

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Will filter bibles based upon the media type of their filesets

parameters.name: media_exclude
parameters.description: Will exclude bibles based upon the media type of their filesets

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Will filter bibles based upon the size type of their filesets

parameters.name: size_exclude
parameters.description: Will exclude bibles based upon the size type of their filesets

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset_id to filter results by.

get.summary: Returns a list of translated book names and general information for the given Bible
get.description: The actual list of books may vary from fileset to fileset. For example, a King James Fileset may contain deuterocanonical books that are missing from one of it's sibling filesets nested within the bible parent.

parameters.name: book_id
parameters.description: The book id. For a complete list see the `book_id` field in the `/bibles/books` route.

parameters.name: verify_content
parameters.description: Filter all the books that have content

get.summary: Available bible defaults per language code
get.description: Available bible defaults per language code

parameters.name: language_code
parameters.description: The language code to filter results by

get.description: All bible fileset's copyright information and organizational connections

parameters.name: bible_id
parameters.description: The Bible ID to retrieve the copyright information for

parameters.name: iso
parameters.description: The iso code to filter organization translations by. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route.

get.summary: Returns the books of the Bible
get.description: Returns all of the books of the Bible both canonical and deuterocanonical

get.summary: Returns the books of the Bible
get.description: Returns the books and chapters for a specific fileset

parameters.name: fileset_type
parameters.description: The type of fileset being queried

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The asset id to select the fileset by

get.description: V4's base fileset route

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Bible fileset ID

parameters.name: book
parameters.description: The Book ID. For a complete list see the `book_id` field in the `/bibles/books` route.

parameters.name: chapter
parameters.description: The chapter number

parameters.name: verse_start
parameters.description: Will filter the results by the given start verse

parameters.name: verse_end
parameters.description: Will filter the results by the given end verse

parameters.description: Will filter the results by the given Asset

get.summary: Search a bible for a word

parameters.description: The word or phrase being searched

parameters.name: fileset_id
parameters.description: The Bible fileset ID

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The Bible fileset asset_id

parameters.name: relevance_order
parameters.description: When set to true the returned result will be ordered by relevance

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of search results to return

parameters.name: books
parameters.description: The usfm book ids to search through seperated by a comma

get.description: Returns a list of the world's known scripts. This route might be useful to you if you'd like to you if you'd like to query information about fonts, alphabets, and the world's writing systems. Some fileset returns may not display correctly without a font delivered by these via the `alphabets/{id}` routes.
Returns a single alphabet along with whatever bibles and languages using it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The alphabet ID

get.description: Returns the List of Countries

parameters.name: l10n
parameters.description: When set to a valid three letter language iso, the returning results will be localized in the language matching that iso. (If an applicable translation exists). For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: has_filesets
parameters.description: Filter the returned countries to those containing languages that have filesets

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Filter the returned countries to only those containing filesets for a specific asset

parameters.name: include_languages
parameters.description: When set to true, the return will include the major languages used in each country. You may optionally also include the language names by setting it to `with_names`

get.description: Returns a single Country
Returns the List of Languages

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country

parameters.name: iso
parameters.description: The iso code to filter languages by. For a complete list see the `iso` field in the `/languages` route

parameters.name: language_name
parameters.description: The language_name field will filter results by a specific language name

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The bucket_id

parameters.name: include_alt_names
parameters.description: The include_alt_names

parameters.name: show_all
parameters.description: Will show all entries

parameters.name: random
parameters.description: Will order the entries randomly

parameters.name: show_bibles
parameters.description: Will show all bibles details

get.description: Returns a single Language

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The language ID

id.title: id
id.description: The Archivist created Bible ID string. This will be between six and twelve letters usually starting with the iso639-3 code and ending with the acronym for the Bible

date.title: date
date.description: The year the Bible was originally published

derived.title: derived
derived.description: This field indicates the Bible from which the current Scriptures being described are derived.

copyright.title: copyright
copyright.description: A short copyright description for the bible text.

in_progress.title: in_progress
in_progress.description: If the Bible being described is currently in progress.

versification.title: versification
versification.description: The versification system for ordering books and chapters

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the bible was last updated

BibleBook.title: Bible Book
BibleBook.description: The Bible Book Model stores the vernacular book titles and chapters

name.title: name
name.description: The name of the book in the language of the bible

name_short.title: name_short
name_short.description: If the vernacular name has an abbreviated form, it will be stored hre

chapters.title: chapters
chapters.description: A string of the chapters in the book separated by a comma

BibleEquivalent.title: BibleEquivalent
BibleEquivalent.description: The Bible Equivalent Model stores the connections between the bible IDs and external organizations

type.title: type
type.description: The type of connection that the equivalent id refers to

site.title: site
site.description: The name of the site/organization/app where the equivalent id is based

suffix.title: site
suffix.description: Additional metadata affecting the type of equivalent connection

constructed_url.title: Constructed Url
constructed_url.description: The full path to the resource which the equivalent describes

BibleFile.title: BibleFile
BibleFile.description: The Bible File Model communicates information about biblical files stored in S3

id.title: id
id.description: The id

chapter_end.title: chapter_end
chapter_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple chapters this field indicates the last chapter of the selection

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse at which the BibleFile reference begins

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: If the Bible File spans multiple verses this value will indicate the last verse in that reference. This value is inclusive, so for the reference John 1:1-4. The value would be 4 and the reference would contain verse 4.

verse_text.title: verse_text
verse_text.description: If the BibleFile model returns text instead of a file_name this field will contain it.
verse_text.example: And God said unto Abraham, And as for thee, thou shalt keep my covenant, thou, and thy seed after thee throughout their generations.

duration.title: duration
duration.description: If the file has a set length of time, this field indicates that time in milliseconds

BibleFileTimestamp.description: The Bible File Timestamp tag model partitions the file into verse by verse sections

id.title: file_id
id.description: The incrementing id of the file timestamp

verse_start.title: verse_start
verse_start.description: The starting verse for the file timestamp

verse_end.title: verse_end
verse_end.description: The ending verse for the file timestamp

timestamp.title: timestamp
timestamp.description: The time (in seconds) represented by the timestamp

id.title: id
id.description: The fileset id

hash_id.title: hash_id
hash_id.description: The hash_id generated from the `asset_id`, `set_type_code`, and `id`

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: The timestamp at which the fileset was originally created

updated_at.title: updated_at
updated_at.description: The timestamp at which the fileset was last updated

hash_id.title: hash id
hash_id.description: The hash value for the created fileset

BibleFilesetSize.description: The Bible fileset size model communicates information about generalized fileset sizes

sex.title: The Gender of the User
sex.description: This field aligns with the ISO/IEC 5218 Standard. Codes for the representation of human sexes is an international standard that defines a representation of human sexes through a language-neutral single-digit code.

reset_path.title: reset_path
reset_path.description: The url to the location that contains the password reset form. Note this should end with a / and expect the final url path item to be a token. Example: https://example.com/password/reset/ with the expectation of receiving https://example.com/password/reset/{TOKEN_ID}

highlighted_color.title: highlighted_color
highlighted_color.description: The highlight's highlighted color in either hex, rgb, or rgba notation.

highlight_start.title: highlight_start
highlight_start.description: The number of words from the beginning of the verse to start the highlight at. For example, if the verse Genesis 1:1 had a `highlight_start` of 4 and a highlighted_words equal to 2. The result would be: In the beginning `[God created]` the heavens and the earth.

highlighted_words.title: highlighted_words
highlighted_words.description: The number of words being highlighted. For example, if the verse Genesis 1:1 had a `highlight_start` of 4 and a highlighted_words equal to 2. The result would be: In the beginning `[God created]` the heavens and the earth.
